content.description: Start skimmer and make the moves up to the big left facing flake. Then instead of going right make a big move up to a flake on the left side of the arete. Top out from there.
content.protection: 1 or 2 pads, it's pretty easy to step off as the rock is right behind you.
content.location: About 300 feet southwest of the Sign of the Cross Boulder. Uphill or away from the ranch house towards the Mopboys area. You will pass by the Term boulder on the way. Look for the Juniper it's the only bush on the horizon.

content.description: Climb the left side of the east face on small edges. Avoid good holds to the right and the arete to the left.
content.location: On the wall to the right of Sign of the Cross. It climbs the streak to the left of Lughead V0-

content.description: Start deep in a pit on a good right facing flake.  Climb up to a great left facing flake then make a big move right.  Establish yourself in the dihedral and throw for the top.  Well protected as the rock behind is never far behind.
content.location: About 300 feet southwest of the Sign of the Cross Boulder.  Uphill or away from the ranch house towards the Mopboys area.  You will pass by the Term boulder on the way.

content.description:
Sit down start on slopers on the right hand side of the little cave/entrance. Make some fun moves up on slopers and finish by groveling through a hole at the top of the tunnel. 

  A fun problem marred by an awkward and uncomfortable finish.
content.location: To the right of Sign of the Cross/Chablanke. On the right hand side of the tunnel leading into the room from a low sit down start.

content.description: High start (may have to stack pads if you're shorter) on good holds.  Big move up to a right-hand decent hold then up to the cross.  Another big move then top out to the left.  High and scary, but super fun.
content.protection: crash pads and spotters (and a prayer).
content.location: The cross-shaped hold is an obvious landmark that you are on the right problem.

content.description: start low in vertical crack traverse right into scoop top out left (if anyone has the proper name/grade, im just guessing)
content.location: the obvious scoop feature on the backside of sign of the cross

content.description: Start on Chablanke and go into the starting holds of Choir Boys Light. Big move out to a slopey hold from starting holds of Chablanke with your left hand then do a heel hook with your right heel to the starting hold and a left toe hook in a hueco just below. Getting to the starting holds of Choir Boys Light and let go of your footholds with a swing out!
Facing "Sign of the Cross" and "Choirboys", this is an obvious seam of big huecos.
content.location: In the Sign of the Cross alcove.

content.description: Start on the jug after the cave portion of Choir Boys and move left on the slopy underclings to the crimper top out.

Would be 4 stars if you did not have to grovel in the dirt and the adjacent rock was not right behind your back as you are finishing the problem. Stellar movement none the less makes for a great problem. 

  Start on the right facing sloper shelf down under the roof with a foot out right. Move to a left facing sloping shelf out right and push yourself into it getting a foot up back to your left. Move into an undercling and push out to a juggy horn with your right hand. The original Choire Boys (Choire Boys Lite) starts from here. Move out left to a sloper on the far side of a block that hangs down and get a right heal on a little tooth to the right of the horn. Come right hand into an undercling on the back side of the block and step on the horn to make a reach out left to a pretty good rounded hold in a crack. Plug some kneebars, right, left or both. Work the rounded crack untill you can reach out right onto the face and a good edge that you can match. From here reach up left to the lip then up right to a flake pocket. Foot work is cruscial going for the lip as the next boulder is right on your back, through a sweatshirt on it or something so that if you blow it you don't tear up your back.  

Location

  Starts down in the cave just left of Sign of the Cross from a low SDS.
Sit start to Sign of the Cross.
Always shady, this area is a lovely sheltered alcove formed by boulders.
